text: During the 1978–79 English football season, Leicester City F.C. competed in the Football League Second Division. ==Season summary== In the 1978–79 season, Jock Wallace left Rangers to become Leicester's new boss following the Foxes' relegation from the First Division. It was a disappointing season for the Foxes but were not helped by lack of finances to sign quality players but the only positive from the season was that Wallace had to use youth policy and play some youngsters and it brought some success in results. Despite that they finished the season in 17th place. ==Final league table== ;Results summary ;Results by round ==Results== Leicester City's score comes first ===Legend=== {| class="wikitable"
